alert.note: Alert for Boone; De Kalb; Kane; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 5:39AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Illinois, including the following counties, in north central Illinois, Boone and De Kalb. In northeast Illinois, Kane and McHenry. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional isolated amounts up to an inch are possible before the storms move out of the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... DeKalb, Belvidere, Sycamore, Marengo, Genoa, Elburn, Cortland, Kirkland, Maple Park, Kingston, Lily Lake, Garden Prairie and Virgil. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
